taskbody.context: If a page is not rendering properly in some browsers, you can force the theme to be rendered in XHTML or HTML5 by creating a DocType XML file.

steps.step: Create a DocType XML file with the same name as your layout template file, followed by .doctype.xml. If your layout template file is called MyAwesomeLayout.html, give your DocType file the name MyAwesomeLayout.doctype.xml.

Enter one of the following in your DocType file:
For XHTML Strict,
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
For XHTML Transitional,
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
For HTML5,
<!DOCTYPE html>
